snippet.title: Next ScienceLab Class 1 Science CBSE l Activity Time | Community Helpers
snippet.description:
Next ScienceLab Class 1 Science CBSE l Activity Time | Community Helpers

The Science Explorer Kit is an innovative solution for learning science that lives up to the true meaning of a Lab. The age and grade appropriate box is designed to enable each learner to experience the testing, exploration and application of various scientific concepts.

The guidelines of the National curriculum Framework (NCF) recommend the use of hands-on activities to impart science lessons as they help students gain an understanding of abstract concepts.

In this Video we will do activity on Community Helpers 

Community Helpers– In this activity,  students need to make a model of  community helpers by matching the name of the community helper with his/her uniform and role. This activity enable students to know about the different services provided by community helpers and also help them understand the interdependence of people in society.



To watch the complete lesson, register to get 5-day full access for free

visit - http://bit.ly/2KbImVd

snippet.title: Next ScienceLab Class 7 Science CBSE l Activity Time | Shadow Of Time
snippet.description:
Next ScienceLab Class 7 Science CBSE l Activity Time | Shadow Of Time

The Science Explorer Kit is an innovative solution for learning science that lives up to the true meaning of a Lab. The age and grade appropriate box is designed to enable each learner to experience the testing, exploration and application of various scientific concepts.

The guidelines of the National curriculum Framework (NCF) recommend the use of hands-on activities to impart science lessons as they help students gain an understanding of abstract concepts.

In this Video we will do activity on Shadow Of Time

Shadow of time– The shadow of time model is a simpler version of a sundial. The model has an hour and a latitude sticker. It also has a compass and other materials. The students learn the working of a sundial through this model.  The model help them understand how people used to tell time in the past using the sundial.

snippet.title: Next ScienceLab Class 8 Science CBSE l Activity Time | Reactivity Race
snippet.description:
Next ScienceLab Class 8 Science CBSE l Activity Time | Reactivity Race 

The Science Explorer Kit is an innovative solution for learning science that lives up to the true meaning of a Lab. The age and grade appropriate box is designed to enable each learner to experience the testing, exploration and application of various scientific concepts.

The guidelines of the National curriculum Framework (NCF) recommend the use of hands-on activities to impart science lessons as they help students gain an understanding of abstract concepts.

In this Video we will do activity on Reactivity Race

Reactivity Race– Students learn about the displacement reactions of different metals in this activity. They observe the reactions of metal strips with different solutions. Hence, the students understand the reactivity of the different metals they used. Four types of metals strips are given to the students. First of all, they prepare water and acid based  solutions in different vacationers. Then, they observe the reaction of the metal strips with these solutions. Through this process, students understand the reactivity of the different metals used by them.

To watch the complete lesson, register to get 5-day full access for free

visit - http://bit.ly/2KbImVd

snippet.title: Next ScienceLab Class 10 Science CBSE l Human Eye and Defects | Activity Time
snippet.description:
Next ScienceLab Class 10 Science CBSE l Human Eye and Defects | Activity Time

The Science Explorer Kit is an innovative solution for learning science that lives up to the true meaning of a Lab. The age and grade appropriate box is designed to enable each learner to experience the testing, exploration and application of various scientific concepts.

The guidelines of the National curriculum Framework (NCF) recommend the use of hands-on activities to impart science lessons as they help students gain an understanding of abstract concepts.

In this Video we will do activity on Human Eye and Defects


Human Eye and its Defects–  The functioning of the human eye is explained by using the model. Students understand how images are formed in the eyes using different lenses. They learn about the effect of conditions such as myopia and hypermetropia on image formation. Furthermore, the activity introduces them to the various types of corrections used to fix these defects.
